unnormalised: **Telecom Sector Sees Competitive Pricing in Data Plans**
normalised: telecom sector sees competitive pricing in data plans

unnormalised: New Delhi, October 26th - India's telecommunications market continues to witness aggressive competition among providers in the data plan segment. Reliance Jio, Airtel, and Vodafone Idea are rolling out revised plans, focusing on bundled OTT subscriptions to entice users.
normalised: new delhi, october twenty sixth - India's telecommunications market continues to witness aggressive competition among providers in the data plan segment. reliance jio, airtel, and vodafone idea are rolling out revised plans, focusing on bundled o t t subscriptions to entice users.

unnormalised: Analysts at IIM Ahmedabad predict that data consumption will surge by 30% year-on-year, driven by the increased adoption of 5G and affordable smartphone access.
normalised: analysts at I I M ahmedabad predict that data consumption will surge by thirty percent year on year, driven by the increased adoption of five g and affordable smartphone access.

unnormalised: The latest Jio plan offers 2GB daily data with a free subscription to Zee5, reminiscent of the entertainment value seen in a classic Bollywood potboiler like "Amar Akbar Anthony," catering to diverse tastes. Airtel is countering with enhanced family plans offering up to 75GB monthly data and free calls.
normalised: the latest jio plan offers two g b daily data with a free subscription to zee five, reminiscent of the entertainment value seen in a classic bollywood potboiler like "amar akbar anthony," catering to diverse tastes. airtel is countering with enhanced family plans offering up to seventy five g b monthly data and free calls.

unnormalised: Vodafone Idea (Vi) is focusing on providing weekend data rollover and bundled data packs specifically for students. The average data plan now costs around Rs. 249 for 28 days, offering approximately 1.5GB daily data. Experts suggest this trend will continue to benefit consumers, particularly in Tier-II and Tier-III cities where data accessibility remains a key driver of growth.
normalised: vodafone idea (V I) is focusing on providing weekend data rollover and bundled data packs specifically for students. the average data plan now costs around rupee two hundred and forty nine for twenty eight days, offering approximately one point five g b daily data. experts suggest this trend will continue to benefit consumers, particularly in tier two and tier three cities where data accessibility remains a key driver of growth.
